intro: Aspidogyne chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan aspidogyne, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
